entities.name: XBOX GAME STUDIOS
entities.description: A collection of first-party studios creating iconic and differentiated gaming experiences.

entities.name: XBOX GAME PASS
entities.description: A subscription service and gaming community with access to a curated library of over 100 first- and third-party console and PC titles.

entities.name: MICROSOFT
entities.description: A technology company that owns Xbox and operates Xbox Cloud Gaming.

entities.name: VERIZON MEDIA GROUP
entities.description: A company partnered with Microsoft's Search business to provide and monetize search queries.

entities.name: APPLE
entities.description: A technology company competing with Microsoft's Windows and gaming platforms.

entities.name: GOOGLE
entities.description: A technology company competing with Microsoft's Windows and gaming platforms.

entities.name: NINTENDO
entities.description: A gaming company competing with Microsoft's console platforms.

entities.name: SONY
entities.description: A technology and gaming company competing with Microsoft's console platforms.

entities.name: TENCENT
entities.description: A company operating online gaming ecosystems and game streaming services competing with Microsoft's cloud gaming services.

entities.name: FACEBOOK
entities.description: A social media platform competing with Microsoft's gaming and search businesses.

relationships.relationship_description: Xbox Game Studios is a collection of first-party studios owned by Microsoft.
Xbox Game Pass is a subscription service and gaming community operated by Microsoft.
Verizon Media Group is partnered with Microsoft's Search business to provide and monetize search queries.
Apple competes with Microsoft's Windows and gaming platforms.
Google competes with Microsoft's Windows and gaming platforms.
Nintendo competes with Microsoft's console platforms.
Sony competes with Microsoft's console platforms.
Tencent operates online gaming ecosystems and game streaming services competing with Microsoft's cloud gaming services.
Facebook competes with Microsoft's gaming and search businesses.
